sections.body: (1) This Act may be called the Police Act, 1888.

sections.section_title: Constitution of police forces for special purposes
sections.body: (1) Notwithstanding anything in the Police Act, 1861 (V of 1861), the Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, create a special police district embracing parts of two or more Provinces, and extend to every part of the said district the powers and jurisdiction of members of a police force belonging to any part of Pakistan specified in the notification.

sections.section_title: Employment of police officers beyond the province to which they belong
sections.body: Notwithstanding anything in any of the Acts mentioned or referred to in the last foregoing section, but subject to any orders which the Federal Government may make in this behalf, a member of the police force of any Province may discharge the functions of a police-officer in any part of Pakistan beyond the limits of the Province.

sections.section_title: Consent of Provincial Government to exercise of powers and jurisdiction
sections.body: Nothing in this Act shall be deemed to enable the police of one Province to exercise powers and jurisdiction in any area within another Province, not being a railway area, without the consent of the Government of that other Province.
